column4: what i did when developing some python code was to install latest / cvs versions of stuff i need in $HOME/usr
that's a possible alternative, I want something more integrated on the system. I believe /usr/local/ exists for that purpose.
yeah, but you never need to sudo / su anything. i feel that my system is fairly 'safe' if i work in my home dir
obviously this is of no use if more than one user needs the stuff
